did.unittitle: Henry Stephen Lucas collection 1846-1930
did.abstract: Professor of history at the University of Washington. Manuscripts, pamphlets, maps, pictures, newspapers, and other materials dealing with the Dutch migration to America collected for his book Netherlanders in America.

repository.corpname: Bentley Historical Library, University of Michigan

acqinfo.p: The microfilm was donated by Henry S. Lucas (donor no. 3535) in 1959.

accruals.p: No further additions to the papers are expected.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open to research.

userestrict.p: Copyright is not held by the Regents of the University of Michigan.

prefercite.p: [item], folder, box, Henry Stephen Lucas collection, Bentley Historical Library, University of Michigan

bioghist.p: Henry S. Lucas was born and raised near Holland, Michigan. He attended the Universities of Leiden and Ghent. He received his A.B. from Olivet College (1913) and his doctorate from the University of Michigan (1921). He taught history at the University of Washington and has written several books and articles on the medieval history of the Low Countries. In 1955, he published Netherlanders in America; Dutch Immigration to the United States and Canada, 1789-1950.

scopecontent.p: The Lucas collection consists of manuscripts, pamphlets, maps, pictures, newspapers, and other materials dealing with the Dutch migration to America collected for his book Netherlanders in America.
